definition: dialectal or obsolete equivalent of 媽|妈[ma1]/Taiwan pr. [ma1]
suffix, used to form interrogative 什麼|什么[shen2 me5], what?, indefinite 這麼|这么[zhe4 me5] thus, etc

sentences.english: Dipa Ma challenged students belief in and attachment to their stories.
sentences.chinese: 蒂帕嬤挑戰那些信任並且執著他們的故事的學生。

sentences.english: Dipa Ma's abbilities in this regard were once tested by a third party.
sentences.chinese: 蒂帕嬤的這方面的神通曾由第三方測試過。

sentences.english: But when you are standing before Grandma, you need to speak out bravely.
sentences.chinese: 但是你到了阿嬤面前，你一定要勇敢說出來。

sentences.english: I could tell that she was probably a very affectionate and dependent woman.
sentences.chinese: 知道她可能是一位很會撒嬌，很黏人的阿嬤。

sentences.english: In 1965, Dipa Ma was drawn into a new dimension of spiritual practice.
sentences.chinese: 在1965年，蒂帕嬤被帶進了一個新的禪修領域。

sentences.english: My grandmother used to make her own soy sauce for us.
sentences.chinese: 我的阿嬤以前會自己做醬油給我們喫。

sentences.english: Dipa Ma learned to cook food by making the fire element come out of her hands.
sentences.chinese: 蒂帕嬤學會了用她的手產生火元素來生火做飯。

sentences.english: Often Dipa Ma simply rested in silence.
sentences.chinese: 蒂帕嬤經常在靜默中簡單地休息。
蒂帕嬤不斷地發出慈愛。

sentences.english: Here comes a recycling truck. It takes all of Granny's bottles away.
sentences.chinese: 資源回收車來了，把阿嬤的瓶子都載走了。

sentences.english: Lucy's grandmother loves her very much.
Take Dipa Ma's advice to heart.
sentences.chinese: 將蒂帕嬤的忠告銘記於心吧。

sentences.english: Dipa Ma stated firmly that if you want peace, you must practice regularly.
sentences.chinese: 蒂帕嬤堅決地說，如果你想平靜你就得經常地修習。

definition: plant mentioned in Book of Songs, uncertainly identified as carambola or star fruit (Averrhoa carambola)
dialectal equivalent of 沒有|没有[mei2 you3]
old variant of 叫[jiao4]/ancient musical instrument similar to ocarina
